intro: Platylepis angolensis, commonly known as the Angola flatleaf, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes buckwheats and sedges. The plant is characterized by its broad, flat leaves and small, clustered flowers that bloom in spring. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
